lead_paragraph: Bills running back Marshawn Lynch had his driver’s license revoked in traffic court after saying he did not know he had hit someone May 31 while driving in Buffalo. Lynch pleaded guilty on a charge of failure to exercise due care; he also received the maximum $100 fine and $50 surcharge. A plea deal allowed him to avoid a hit-and-run charge.
